title.narrative: Supporting Iraqi refugees and vulnerable Jordanians through livelihood opportunities

description.narrative: Caritas Jordan is working to maintain the basic needs for Iraqi household refugees and vulnerable Jordanians through enhancing the livelihoods opportunities inside the Business Definition Areas-BDAs’, and looking towards a better future for the beneficiaries, which this project can enable them to: - Promote the Livelihoods training skills (Basic Life skills and Occupational skills) for 100 adult Refugees and local Jordanian communities, in two new occupational skills in Agriculture field (Composting) and Herbal drying and packing for 20 training days; 4 training hours per day. - Cash for Work-CFW: To secure 22 refugees and vulnerable Jordanians families with necessary Income through Cash for Work opportunity inside the “Business Definition Area” that can help promote their resilience and generate an income for at least 2 cycles of work - Development approach: Upgrading new machines and tools or extending the work or adding new workshops based on the needs for the existing workshops - Promote Production quality: by doing items’ Registration, Certification, products design and marketing the products inside and outside Jordan. In which supporting the sustainable approach of the BDAs’ system.
